trans-unit.source: Provides access to the property values of a <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.DockPattern"></xref> object using its <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.DockPattern.Current"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.DockPattern.Cached"></xref> accessors.

The properties in this structure can also be retrieved by using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCurrentPropertyValue%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCachedPropertyValue%2A>, using the corresponding identifiers from <xref:System.Windows.Automation.DockPattern>.

For example, The <xref:System.Windows.Automation.DockPattern.DockPatternInformation.DockPosition%2A> property is identified by the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.DockPattern.DockPositionProperty> field.
More information about the individual properties is available on the reference pages for those identifiers; see the link in the Remarks section of each reference topic.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.DockPosition"></xref> of an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement"></xref> within a docking container.

A docking container is a control that allows the arrangement of child elements, both horizontally and vertically, relative to the boundaries of the docking container and other elements within the container.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.DockPosition"></xref> of the element, relative to the boundaries of the docking container and other elements within the container.
